climbs.name: Affair with Professor Higgins
climbs.fa: Gus Lambregst and Larry LaForge, c.1981

content.description: Climb the juggy crack with great foot holds.
content.location: It is #4 in the photo. This ascends the next crack to the right of The Militant Fist.

content.description: Boston Rocks says "Hard dyno off of small sharp crimps", though I think there could be more to it than that. There are several nice sharp crimps on the more overhanging part of the boulder between #1 and #3 in the photo. If anyone has a more specific description, please add to this page.
Climb diagonal jugs to the right of Affair with Professor Higgins from a sit.
content.location: This begins between #4 and #5 in the photo and moves up and right to finish near Crack a Book.

content.description: Start matched on flake/rail just to the right of the inconveniently placed rock. Work straight up on nice crimps leading to juggier holds. Finish on a slightly slopery mantel for the topout.
content.location: It is right of The Algebraist and left of Problem Set.

climbs.name: The Militant Fist
climbs.fa: Gus Lambregst and Larry LaForge, c.1981

content.description: Climb the super fun fist crack.
This is a nice left to right traverse of the boulder.
content.location: Start at the big crack and move right to finish at the very end of the boulder.

content.description: Double Trouble is a run and jump problem that is located to the right of the juggy crack (Affair with Professor Higgins).Â Launch off the large foot ledge at the bottom, and jump straight up to a good right and downwards slanting ledge right of the topout of (Affair with Professor Higgins). The crack is off.
content.location: It is right of Affair with Professor Higgins.

climbs.name: Crack a Book
climbs.fa: Gus Lambregst and Larry LaForge, c.1981

content.description: This ascends the offwidth crack toward the far right end of the boulder. It is super fun.

climbs.name: The Algebraist
climbs.fa: Gus Lambregst and Larry LaForge c.1981

climbs.name: The Algebraist Sit Start
climbs.fa: Gus Lambregst and Larry LaForge, c.1981

content.description: This is #1 in the photo, but "sit start from a pointy stone".

This is a small boulder on the W side of the dirt road.  It is probably only 10 feet tall. 

  L->R:   A1. The Algebraist, 8.   A2. The Algebraist (sit start), 10-.   B. Problem Set, V7.   C. The Militant Fist, 9.   D. Affair With Professor Higgins, 4.   E. Crack a Book, 5. 

Knockin' Traverse, V3-4.
